title: Brazil hits 700,000 virus deaths, 2nd highest in the world
description: Brazil’s government has reported the 700,000th death from COVID-19 in the South American nation, which has the second most victims of the virus after the United States

title: Girl's body pulled from Ecuador landslide, raising toll to 8
description: Rescuers have pulled the body of a 6-year-old girl from the rubble of a house buried by a big landslide in central Ecuador, raising the confirmed death toll to eight

title: Ernie Bot, China’s answer to ChatGPT, is delayed — again
description: Baidu's Ernie Bot is not being rolled out to the public. But we found Ernie Bot shuts down the conversation when asked about anything remotely sensitive.

title: France battered by protests over pension plans as Macron holds firm
description: Emmanuel Macron is staking his reputation and legacy on a raising the retirement age, but the plan — and the way he pushed it through — remains deeply unpopular.

title: Visitors flock to see David sculpture after Florida uproar
description: Visitors have flocked to see Michelangelo’s David sculpture in Florence following the uproar over the Renaissance masterpiece at a Florida school

title: Pirates board oil tanker with 16 crew in Gulf of Guinea
description: Pirates have boarded a Liberian-flagged tanker oil tanker with 16 crew members in the Gulf of Guinea

title: Randall Robinson, founder of influential Africa lobby, dies at 81
description: The founding executive director of TransAfrica was for years the foremost U.S. activist representing Africans and the African diaspora.

title: Pakistan says it will skip US democracy summit amid turmoil
description: Pakistan says it will not participate in this week’s U.S.-led Summit for Democracy, a move seen in part as an effort by the impoverished Islamic nation to assuage longtime ally China, which was not invited

title: Boat carrying 32 capsizes in eastern Caribbean; 16 missing
description: Authorities say one person has died and 16 are missing after a boat capsized near the eastern Caribbean island of St. Kitts

title: Brueghel work found in dim French TV room sells for $845,000
description: One of Flemish painter Pieter Brueghel the Younger’s largest known works, whose discovery behind the television room door of a house in northern France amazed the art world, has fetched 780,000 euros ($845,000) at auction in Paris

title: Brazil has a new biggest favela, and not in Rio de Janeiro
description: For the first time since poverty, lack of opportunity and economic inequality caused favelas to mushroom across many of the nation’s cities, Brazil’s biggest favela isn’t in Rio de Janeiro

title: Ethiopia’s PM announces outreach to rebel group in Oromia
description: Ethiopia’s prime minister says his administration is attempting talks with an outlawed rebel group operating mainly in the restive Oromia region

title: Greek police arrest 2 suspected of planning terror attacks
description: Police in Greece say they have arrested two terrorism suspects who had been planning attacks in the country aimed at causing mass casualties

title: North Korean hackers play the ‘long con’ by targeting experts
description: North Korea's cyberattack capabilities are becoming more sophisticated in the service of Kim Jong Un’s nuclear ambitions, according to a new report.

title: EU deal to move migrant children from Greece officially ends
description: A voluntary scheme joined by European Union member states to accept unaccompanied migrant children from Greece has officially ended as the bloc still struggles to hammer out a comprehensive new migration agreement

title: US, UK sanction 6 Syria-linked amphetamine traffickers
description: The U.S. and U.K. say they have slapped sanctions on four Syrians and two Lebanese involved in manufacturing and trafficking the amphetamine drug Captagon

title: Russia sentences dad to jail after daughter’s antiwar art, but he flees
description: With his 13-year-old daughter already confined to an orphanage, Alexei Moskalyov made a dramatic escape rather than face two years in prison for posting antiwar views online.

title: India's warm weather plans can't take the heat, report says
description: With temperatures set to soar next month, Indian authorities need more resources and better preparation to deal with searing heat particularly for the most vulnerable communities around the country, a New Delhi-based think tank said

title: Russia convicts father of teen who drew antiwar pictures
description: Officials say a Russian court has convicted a single father over social media posts criticizing the war in Ukraine and sentenced him to two years in prison

title: In Photos: Fire at migrant center in Mexico near U.S. border kills dozens
description: A fire broke out at a migrant detention facility close to the U.S.-Mexico border, killing at least 39 people and injuring 29, the Mexican government said Tuesday, calling the deaths a “tragedy.”

title: EU defends its Libya migrant record over UN team allegations
description: The European Union is defending its record on helping relieve migrant suffering in Libya after U.N.-backed investigators accused the bloc of abetting human rights abuses and other crimes there

title: Uncrewed Russian spacecraft that leaked coolant lands safely
description: A Russian spacecraft has safely returned to Earth without a crew months after suffering a coolant leak in orbit

title: What we know about the Nashville Christian school shooting
description: Here’s some of what we know and don’t know about the deadly shooting at The Covenant School in Nashville

title: Posters near Vatican urge pope to stop Latin Mass crackdown
description: Posters calling on Pope Francis to stop his crackdown on the old Latin Mass have appeared around the Vatican

title: Amnesty: West's 'double standards' fuel Mideast repression
description: A leading international rights group has decried what it said were double standards by Western countries that have rallied behind a “robust response” to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine but remain “lukewarm” on issues of human rights violations in the Middle East

title: Portugal: 2 dead, several injured in Muslim center stabbing
description: Portuguese police have shot a man suspected of stabbing two people to death at an Ismaili Muslim center in Lisbon

title: After protest pause, Israelis regroup for next round in judiciary battle
description: Despite the pause declared by Benjamin Netanyahu, both sides expect the battle over the future of Israel's judiciary to reignite soon.

title: Migration to Italy is soaring. And it’s still the off-season.
description: People are reaching the country at a pace unmatched by any winter and early spring on record. Daily arrivals often surpass totals for the whole month in past years.

title: Warehouse fire kills 11 people in China's northern province
description: Chinese authorities are investigating the cause of a fire that broke out at an abandoned refrigerated warehouse in the country’s northern industrial province, Hebei

title: Report: Renewable energy growth falls short of climate goal
description: The International Renewable Energy Agency says deployment of new wind and solar power plants needs to be drastically ramped up by the end of the decade to meet the world’s climate goals

title: Why is Prince Harry in London? His (latest) battle against the press.
description: Prince Harry is joining Elton John and Elizabeth Hurley in taking Associated Newspapers and its tabloids to task for phone hacking and surveillance over the years.

title: Reports: Dozens dead in fire at migrant facility in Mexico
description: A Mexican newspaper reports that at least three dozen migrants died in a fire at an immigration detention center in northern Mexico near the U.S. border

title: Freed 'Hotel Rwanda' hero in Qatar, heading to family in US
description: The man who inspired the film “Hotel Rwanda” and was freed by Rwanda last week from a terrorism sentence has arrived in Qatar on his way to reuniting with family in the United States

title: Kidjo, Blackwell, Pärt awarded Sweden's Polar Music Prize
description: Singer-songwriter Angélique Kidjo, Island Records founder Chris Blackwell and Estonian composer Arvo Pärt have won the 2023 Polar Music Prize, a Swedish music award

title: Prince Harry returns to court in tabloid phone hacking case
description: Prince Harry has returned to court for the second day of hearings to see if the phone hacking lawsuit he brought with Elton John and other celebrities can withstand a challenge from the publisher of The Daily Mail

title: Fire at migrant center near Mexico-U.S. border; several deaths reported
description: The fire began late Monday night at the National Migration Institute in Ciudad Juárez, close to the Rio Grande.

title: Police in Belgium arrest 8 people in counterterrorism raids
description: Police officers in Belgium have arrested eight people during counterterrorism raids across the country as part of operations aimed at thwarting possible terror attacks

title: UN says Afghan girls' education activist arrested in Kabul
description: The United Nations says an Afghan rights activist who has campaigned for girls’ education has been arrested in Kabul

title: Live updates: France braces for huge strikes over retirement age, raising pressure on Macron
description: Hundreds of thousands across France are set to ramp up protests against President Emmanuel Macron's pension bill, which raises the retirement age from 62 to 64.

title: Shattered: Catholic community confronts its founder's lies
description: An internationally lauded federation that provides community care for people with intellectual disabilities is grappling with revelations that its late founder perverted Catholic doctrine to justify his sexual abuse of women

title: Ukraine live briefing: Russian occupation of nuclear plant is ‘radiation blackmail,’ Zelensky says
description: Rafael Mariano Grossi, chief of the U.N.'s International Atomic Energy Agency, will visit the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant this week.

title: In war-ravaged Lyman, Ukrainians live underground months after liberation
description: Ukrainian forces ousted the Russian occupiers nearly six months ago, but residents of an apartment complex in eastern Ukraine still live in their basements

title: Australian soldier charged over Afghan killing freed on bail
description: An Australian magistrate has released on bail a former elite soldier charged with murder for allegedly killing an unarmed man in Afghanistan

title: Netanyahu’s Israel finds kindred spirits in Hungary and Poland
description: The desire of Israel’s ruling far-right coalition to overhaul the judiciary is, in part, inspired by the success of illiberal nationalists elsewhere.
